title: MLAs quiz official on 'flawed' £1bn Renewable Heat Incentive scheme - BBC News
summary: public accounts committee questions civil servants in inquiry into `` flawed '' £ 1bn heating scheme .
infrastructure minister chris hazzard brief committee on department 's priorities .
electricity administrator soni briefing mlas on north-south interconnector .

documents.title: goodnight
text: and with that lengthy session at an end , that 's all from the hill for today .
join us for our stormont live coverage of the health committee tomorrow morning from 10:30 , and an afternoon sitting of the justice committee .
goodnight for now !

documents.title: 'significant new information has emerged '
text: chair robin swann brings the inquiry sitting to an end , and dr mccormick and his team will reappear before the committee on 12 october .
mr swann says `` significant new information '' has come before the members .

documents.title: 'language in regulations not tight enough '
text: a `` key design flaw '' in the scheme was that once an application was accredited the `` obligation was to continue paying them for 20 years '' .
but he says there is a clause in the some categories of the scheme that allows the department to `` claw back resources '' in cases of `` deliberate deception that would amount to fraud '' .
but pwc has told the department that in some categories `` the language in the regulations is not as tight as it should be '' .
`` maybe there are mistakes in that that we 'll suffer from , '' he adds .

documents.title: 'awareness of potential abuse not acted on '
text: abuse of the scheme had `` come to the attention '' of the department before a whistleblower 's allegation was received in january that prompted an investigation by the audit office , dr mccormick says .
but he adds that the `` awareness of potential abuse '' was `` not acted on - that ca n't be denied '' .
dr mccormick says `` attention was elsewhere '' , particularly on the implementation of a similar scheme for domestic users .
he says the department is now `` seeking to find a way '' to claim money back from applicants receiving an `` unreasonable rates of return '' .
but he adds : `` premature exposure of what we 're thinking about might actually stop it working . ''

documents.title: 'some applicants gaining returns well above intention '
text: matters move on to the `` excessive '' financial returns that participants in the scheme were able to collect .
the dup 's carla lockhart asks how closely the rates being awarded were monitored by department officials .
dr mccormick says the department had information at the scheme 's application stage that `` quite a few '' applicants would be using boilers 24 hours a day .
but there was `` no evidence '' that it had identified that as `` a vulnerability '' , he adds .

he says an investigation by pwc has found a `` very substantial category '' of users whose rates of return were `` well , well above '' what was intended , in some cases `` several times more '' and even `` getting into three figures '' as much .

documents.title: 'heads should roll over scheme mismanagement '
text: `` heads should roll '' as a result of the mismanagement of the scheme , sinn fein 's oliver mcmullan tells the committee .
staff at the department have been `` shocked by what has happened '' and are `` all the more alert '' to spot mistakes in the future , dr mccormick says .
but mr mcmullan says : `` i 've seen things in this assembly , spending £ 20,000 and £ 30,000 , and the earth moved until we found out why did we spend this money .
`` here we are here , in the first five years we are liable for £ 140m because of our overspend - where did this all go wrong ? ''
committee chair robin swann adds : `` for this level of money , this committee will finish out this inquiry - i can guarantee you that . ''

documents.title: 'first scheme i 've seen that legalised fraud '
text: the scheme `` legalised fraud '' , trevor lunn of the alliance party says .
he questions the quality of the legal advice that was given to the department in setting up the scheme , and also asks what planning had been done in the case of high demand .
dr mccormick says : `` once the industry saw what was possible and invested their resources , then it has turned out to be too generous .
`` that goes back to the fundamental misreading [ by the department ] of the consultants ' advice .

documents.title: 'has department looked for evidence of misconduct ? '
text: the department has yet to investigate its staff over potential misconduct in the implementation of the scheme , dr mccormick says .
sinn fein 's michelle gildernew asks him whether a police investigation could be required .
`` you said , andrew , that no evidence had been found that emails were deleted - was evidence looked about ? ''
`` we do need to do a lot of further work on this , '' dr mccormick replies .
`` there is no prima facie evidence of something that would be approaching fraudulent or criminal behaviour .
`` if that was to come to light , we would act on it . ''

documents.title: 'incompetence must be brought out quickly '
text: dr mccormick says £ 14m of an initial £ 25 allocated for the scheme was handed back to the treasury as a result of a lack of applications in its early stages .
he goes on to say that the fact any overspend in terms of the scheme would come from northern ireland 's block grant from the treasury was `` missed '' .

the audit office report into the scheme , which was released in july , said it `` is difficult to estimate the total amount that will have to be met from the block grant '' over the lifetime of the scheme .
but it said it could be in the region of £ 140m over the next five years .
mr mcmullan said the deficit to the block grant has occurred as a result of `` incompetence within the department '' and that `` has to be brought out very , very quickly '' .
`` the treasury warned you all and that was not heeded . ''

documents.title: 'give us confidence , not woolly nonsense '
text: the dup 's trevor clarke says he is `` not up confidence '' from dr mccormick that he has `` grasped the nettle to find out what 's went wrong and prevent this happening again '' .
`` it took us 55 minutes for you to claim some sort of responsibility , '' he tells the permanent secretary .
`` try and give us some confidence that you have done something , that you 're not going to give us any more woolly nonsense about what you 're going to do in the future . ''

documents.title: 'no quick way to turn the tap off '
text: dr mccormick says there scheme was seen to be `` underperforming '' between 2012 and late 2014 , with a lack of applications .
`` uptake was low and we did n't understand why , '' with the department handing money that had been earmarked for the scheme back to the treasury .
`` but when it began to happen , it happened quite quickly , and through significantly design flaws there was no quick way to turn the tap off . ''

documents.title: 'staff turnover through full chain of command '
text: sinn fein 's declan kearney questions the department 's investigative process .
`` when we 're talking about a quantum in the region of £ 1.18bn i think we need to get a perspective in terms of what is incompetence , misconduct , negligence , '' he says .

the south antrim mla asks if answers will ever emerge given that some staff are no longer in post , and dr mccormick says there was a turnover of staff through the `` full chain of command '' in the scheme .

documents.title: 'no alternative but to close scheme '
text: although the initial objectives of the scheme were `` good and worthy '' , there was `` no alternative '' but to close it `` in a fairly hurried fashion '' in february this year , dr mccormick says .
sinn fein 's oliver mcmullan asks if the department has assessed other schemes to ensure they are fit for purpose and do not have weaknesses like the renewable heat incentive scheme did .
dr mccormick says work is continuing within the department in terms of assessing its other grant programmes .
`` if there are others we need to act on , we 'll act on those as well and get to full compliance , '' he says .

documents.title: 'scheme cost almost double original estimate '
text: initial estimates suggested the scheme would cost about £ 660m over 20 years , dr mccormack tells the committee .
but the ultimate cost is almost going to be double that figure , coming in at £ 1.18bn .
`` it 's turned out to be significantly more than expected , '' dr mccormick adds .

documents.title: 'no idea why no tiering system in place '
text: a similar renewable energy scheme ran in the rest of the uk , but in northern ireland no cap or payment tier system was put on the amount of money that could be claimed in proportion to boiler sizes .
that effectively allowed a business to burn unnecessary heat just to collect cash .
`` almost all the serious aspects of this case '' arose as a result of a lack of a tiering system in the scheme , dr mccormick says .
`` we do n't understand why those working on the scheme at the time did not ask further questions , analyse this work and more detail . ''
that is `` quite a damning indictment '' , committee chair robin swann says .

documents.title: scheme 's design was fundamentally wrong '
text: dr mccormick says the officials at the department `` do owe an apology '' for the mistakes in the scheme .
the intent of the scheme had been to `` incentive '' the use of renewable energy , but things went `` fundamentally wrong '' its design , which `` led to opportunities for abuse '' , he says .
its execution has `` been very seriously wrong '' , he adds .

documents.title: background : renewable heat incentive scheme
text: the renewable heat incentive scheme was introduced in 2012 by the former department of enterprise , with the aim of increasing the uptake of renewable heat technologies .

in july this year , the northern ireland audit office stated in a report that `` serious systematic failings '' in the scheme are likely to cost the northern ireland budget `` hundreds of millions of pounds '' .
economy minister simon hamilton described the finding as `` deeply shocking '' .
the audit office investigation was prompted when a whistleblower contacted the northern ireland executive in january alleging that the scheme was being abused .
one of the claims was that a farmer was aiming to collect about £ 1m over 20 years from the scheme for heating an empty shed .

the whistleblower also claimed large factories that had previously not been heated were using the scheme to install boilers with the intention of running them throughout the year to collect about £ 1.5m over 20 years .

documents.title: renewable energy scheme will cost public £ 1.18bn
text: the public accounts committee is conducting an inquiry into failings in the department of enterprise , trade and investment 's renewable heat incentive scheme .
dr andrew mccormick , the permanent secretary at the department for the economy , says that by the end of the scheme it will have cost the public purse a grand total of £ 1.18bn .

documents.title: and that 's lunchtime
text: committee chair william humphrey adjourns the meeting .
join us at 14:00 for what promises to be an interesting meeting of the public accounts committee .
members will be holding an evidence session as part of their inquiry into the non-domestic renewable heat incentive ( rhi ) scheme .

documents.title: 'most fatal crashes caused by carelessness '
text: asssembly researchers barbara love and desmond mckibbin are briefing the committee on road safety .
ms love says that most fatal and serious collisions are caused by carelessness .

documents.title: 'contractors looking for legal loopholes '
text: paul girvan of the dup says he is `` fearful '' that contractors think they `` could actually make more money by taking a legal action against the case than doing the job '' .
he surmises that firms may not be `` really wanting the contract but [ say ] : 'we 'll do it and some legal loophole will appear . ' ''
mr doherty says that 's a `` very possible observation indeed '' .
he adds that the department needs to `` see what we can do to close that down '' .

documents.title: judgement over a8 dual carriageway tender
text: departmental official pat doherty begins his briefing on the fp mccann judgement regarding the a8 dual carriageway project .
this project involved the dualling of 14km of the belfast to larne road .

mr doherty explains that , during the 2009-10 procurement process for the development , a bid from contractors fp mccann and balfour beatty was rejected on the basis that it was `` abnormally low '' .
in a subsequent court case , the judge ruled that fp mccann had suffered a `` loss of chance '' .
mr doherty says fp mccann is claiming £ 13m in recompense .

documents.title: 'opponents only against overhead interconnector '
text: kellie armstrong of alliance says she has been contacted by the safe electricity armagh and tyrone campaign group .
she says they emphasised that they are not opposed to an interconnector , but simply to `` the overhead nature of it '' .
ulster unionist jenny palmer compares the positioning of electricity power lines with wind turbines in areas like donegal .
`` i do think that the benefits do outweigh the arguments for the environment , '' she says .

documents.title: 'this is the only deal in town '
text: declan mcaleer of sinn fein asks why the interconnector could not `` piggyback '' on the line to county louth .
mr mccormick says there could be major problems in the event of a single line failure , and gives the example of a plane crashing into the line .
he adds that `` this is the only deal in town as far as i am concerned '' .

documents.title: 'underground connection a foolish notion '
text: the dup 's paul girvan dismisses the `` foolish notion '' put forward by some people that the connector could be underground .
he says these objectors have `` no realisation '' of the cross-section of the cabling that would be required .
robert mccormick explains how soni factors wind generation into the electricity supply equation .
he says it is doing work `` which takes us away beyond what anyone in the world has been doing '' .

documents.title: 'there 'll always be opposition to project '
text: `` this project is absolutely essential '' , according to mr mccormick , soni 's general manager .
`` it is the most critical infrastructure development on the island today and we must move on it , '' he adds .
mr humphrey asks about opposition to the project .
mr fitzgerald says there is `` a lot of engagement '' , but `` there will always be some opposition to new infrastructure because this is above-ground infrastructure '' .

documents.title: 'need for this project not challenged '
text: mr fitzgerald says that based on reasons of `` cost , technology and environment '' , soni has decided on an overhead line development .
`` the need for this project is not challenged , '' he adds .
natasha sayee of soni says there is a recognition of the interconnector 's role in `` investment , expansion , jobs and reducing customer bills in northern ireland '' .
she says they are reaching out to `` key stakeholders '' including `` the landowners , the residents , the community and , of course , the elected representatives '' .

documents.title: 'interconnector needs £ 90m investment '
text: mr mccormick explains that there is a link between northern ireland and county louth in the republic of ireland , and points out some of the problems that could result the loss of this link .
john fitzgerald outlines the north-south project .
he says the interconnector would stretch 40km in the north and 100km in the south , and would require £ 90m investment north of the irish border .

documents.title: briefing on north-south electricity interconnector progress
text: representatives of soni , the electricity system operator for northern ireland , are now briefing the committee on progress with the north-south electricity interconnector .
robin mccormick from the company explains that soni also operates the all-island wholesale electricity market with eirgrid through the single electricity market operator .
he explains that the all-island market was set up in 2007 .
mr mccormick says changes are being made to the market to ensure that customers benefit from the interconnectors with great britain .

documents.title: 'disappearing royal plaque causes consternation '
text: the dup 's george robinson is concerned with the fate of a plaque unveiled by the queen during the opening ceremony at bellarena halt .
he says it has been removed `` much to the consternation of quite a lot of people in the area '' .
mr hazzard says the plaque was removed to protect it from vandalism and that it will be reinstalled in a safe place .

documents.title: 'get derry 's architectural gem back on track '
text: eamonn mccann of people before profit wants to see trains return to londonderry 's historic railway station .
he says it is `` an architectural gem , a listed building '' opened in 1874 .
the minister says he will be in the city next week to make a major announcement on transport .

documents.title: 'a5 case must be foolproof '
text: daniel mccrossan ( below ) of the sdlp welcomes the minister 's support for the a5 aughnacloy-to-londonderry road scheme .
he is concerned about a forthcoming judicial review and wants assurance that all the necessary preparations have been made by the department .
mr hazzard agrees there is a need to ensure `` that these cases are foolproof '' .
`` i have faith that we have done everything , '' he adds .

documents.title: 'ten-fold increase in blue badge applications '
text: in reply to a question about a backlog in processing the blue badge disabled parking scheme , the minister admits that a decision taken in 2014 to `` let go '' of a number of temporary staff `` was short-sighted '' .
mr hazzard says the number of applications for blue badges has increased 10-fold in recent years .
he says the recent launch of online applications `` inevitably will speed things up big-time '' .

documents.title: 'city transport hub still on priority list '
text: mr humphrey says he is `` alarmed and concerned '' that the minister has not mentioned the proposed belfast transport hub in his presentation .
he asks if the hub has `` dropped off the the department 's priority list '' .
`` absolutely not , '' mr hazzard replies .
he says the transport hub is another project that relied on substantial european funding .
the minister says there challenges ahead for the project but he `` is determined to meet these challenges '' .

documents.title: 'strong committment to narrow water bridge '
text: the minister reiterates his `` strong commitment '' to the narrow water bridge project in his south down constituency .
mr hazzard says he is pleased that , under the stormont house agreement , `` both governments on this island have confirmed they remain supportive of the concept '' .
the minister raises the challenges presented by brexit .
he mentions the york street interchange project in belfast , a roads development depending on a substantial input of eu funds .
mr hazzard says he has instructed his officials to `` continue to pursue all possible sources of european funding '' .

documents.title: 'priority to redress infrastructure deficit '
text: minister chris hazzard begins his briefing on priorities .
he says `` redressing the infrastucture deficit , particularly in the west '' is of great importance .
other priorities are `` improving transport connections and improving public transport '' .

documents.title: carer parents call for law change
text: away from the assembly , a group of parents who are aged over 60 and look after disabled children are calling on mlas to change northern ireland carer laws .
northern ireland is the only part of the uk where the protection of carers is not enshrined in law .

documents.title: several road abandonment orders approved
text: the committee approves a number of minor statutory rules .
these are mainly to do with road abandonment orders in areas as widespread as lurgan , fivemiletown and maghera .

documents.title: in the chair
text: the dup 's william humphrey is chairing this morning 's meeting .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to our first stormont live coverage of this week 's committee proceedings here at parliament buildings .
this morning we have live coverage of the infrastructure committee from the splendour of the old senate chamber .
the session includes a briefing from infrastructure minister chris hazzard .
